title: Warm welcome
text:
We decided to walk the lower paths below Knaresborough and booked lunch at the pub. Phoned a couple of days before and got an amazing response. Friendly, helpful and efficient. Even offered to reserve a car parking space for us!
We walked and the went for lunch on a Friday. What a comfortable and relaxing atmosphere immediately as you step into the place. Staff are welcoming and relaxed. Lighting is low and atmospheric and dogs are welcome. The beer was good and the food excellent. Mussels, sausages with black pudding, plus king prawns all went down a treat. What a fantastic place this is. Highly recommended!

title: Relaxed quality
text: We had vouchers for steak and wine here, so booked for 2 couples. It was well-represented, relaxed and informal and we were very well looked after by Lucas. His bubbly, enthusiastic manner was welcoming without being overbearing. The whole evening was beautifully paced and thoroughly enjoyable. We all opted for steak with peppercorn sauce and a mixture of sides. All perfectly cooked and presented. Recommendations for pudding were accepted and the quality was excellent. It didn't matter one bit about the slight lack of atmosphere. We will be back!

title: Fantastic again!
text:
Amid fears of lockdown, we managed to book a table for last night.
We again enjoyed a fabulous 7-course tasting menu meal in relaxed surroundings. The place was quite busy and we were seated at appropriate distances from other diners and had a truly enjoyable eating experience.
Each course provided amazing variations of texture, taste and aesthetic appeal. I marvel at the skill of the chefs and what consistently excellent food comes out of the kitchen.
It is so sad that they have been forced to close down for the foreseeable future. We would like to thank the staff and look forward to public places re-opening.

title: Impressive hilltop
text: Something that we really wanted to see on our trip to Athens. A great time of year to visit without high temperatures and huge crowds. Only €10 for entry to the site.

title: Excellent use of space
text: We visited here after walking around the Acropolis. A fantastic space, filled with interesting exhibits from the site. Easy to navigate, well signed and even glass floors to peer through. Great excavation of old buildings underneath the museum.

title: One night in Bangkok!
text:
We stayed here for a transit stop-overs as it is close to the airport.
It is a fairly short taxi ride from the International airport and did the job.
We had two rooms with TV, aircon, large beds, fridge and decent bathroom and it felt safe and secure. A bit off the beaten path, you need a map or the phone number of the place handy, just in case the driver can't find it! You can get a shuttle through BA Apartments, so that is what I would recommend. They are very good.
The reception desk lady and the driver could not have been nicer and were not in your face either.
We arrived late and left early, but it was fine for our needs and fitted the bill perfectly.

title: Caught it on a bad day?
text:
We saw the reviews, fancied a stroll for tasty Indian food and that's what we got.
However, we walked in to a right mess, baskets of bowls and plates littered the floor and there was nobody in there apart from two Grab drivers, presumably doing take away deliveries.
We were seated and attended to. We really only wanted a couple of dishes and lots of garlic naan so that's what we ordered along with drinks and poppadoms.However, the waiter returned shortly and explained that there was no garlic naan, not any maan actually and very few of the othet bread options were available. Out of all tje bread options, there were only 5 options, so we made do, rather reluctantly.
Beer and Sprite came quickly, Diet Coke took another 10 minutes and then Lemon juice some time after that.
We had ordered popodums, but the chicken dish arrived first! What Indian restaurant would do that? The chicken dish sat there for 10 minutes untouched, because we wanted bread with it!
Meanwhile popudoms arrived and were devoured long before the next main dish arrived. Still no breads!
The second dish arrived and eventually the bread arrived, but all too random and unconnected. It really spoilt the meal, plus the fact that it was fairly empty.
Quality was great, really tasty and flavoursome. Price-wise, a little on the expensive side for what we got.
Would I go back?? No.

title: Great beach - until dusk!
text:
We stayed a couple of streets back from the beach and saw it early morning, mid day and early evening. What a contrast!
During the day, it is a long, deep, beautiful stretch of beach. Parasol shade and chairs are available for a small fee near the promenade, where there are also drinks and snacks for sale and toilets.
The sea is clean and safe, being only a gradual slope as you walk to get deeper.
The problem is that when the sun starts to fall, the whole world and his dog comes out to the beach in the late afternoon cool.
The high rise buildings shade massive areas of the beach, where hundreds of people congregate to play in the waves and sand. It's manic.
Go there in the heat of the day and get a chair and parasol.

title: Late lunch
text:
Found this place very close to our Homestay and decided to give it a go. The place is quite small, with roof fans and clean, wooden tables. The menu is very limited, but what they do, they do very well. A menu shows accurate photos but there isn't much English spoken.
Great noodle dishes with a range of veg and meat and seafood.
I might have gone 5 star, but we ordered 4 noodle dishes, 2 dry and 2 soup, but we got 3 soups. Minor detail.
Don't be put off. A great little place.

title: Excellent in every respect
text:
We stayed 3 nights in Danang at the end of our trip and it was well worth the little extra that we paid.
Large reception area with excellent, helpful receptionists and doormen, comfortable restaurant with loads of choice and good quality buffet breakfasts.
Room was large with two huge double beds, mini bar, safe, great quality bathroom and spotlessly clean and modern.
Rooftop pool and bar area with super (if restricted) views out over the beach and sea. Prices are reasonable and we had the pool area to ourselves for a lot of our time there.
Location was really good, just a couple of streets back from the main promenade and plenty of eating options.
Could not have been more pleased.
The lady in reception was amazing!
place: Ruby Light Hotel by NNT Hotel Collection

title: Family late-lunch
text:
Seven of us went in search of this place, mid-afternoon and found the place down a lovely, quiet street and it was empty.
That didn't deter us as we were hungry and had read the reviews.
They brought tables and chairs down to street level and we all sat and had a good feed and were well-watered!
Attention was swift and drinks came quickly, food was ordered and took quite a while, but this wasn't a problem, because almost all the food came together, compared with other places where dishes have appeared randomly and at irregular intervals. We ordered a variety of burgers and a chicken/pasta dish, plus two fish dishes. All were very generous potions and the burgers were 'double' thickness, well seasoned and well- cooked with appropriate fillings (cheese, salad, bacon etc).
The fish dishes were battered parcels, but very tasty and loads of food. We had a good go at eating everything and almost made it! Drinks were cold and reasonably priced.
All-in-all a very satisfying experience. Would recommend.

title: Perfect easy eating
text:
We rolled up on a rainy night at about mid-evening and stood at the door as the place was full. The main guy beckoned us in and directed us upstairs and then kindly directed me to the nearest ATM. We sat and ordered from a large choice of meals and opted for chicken in clay pot, chicken lemongrass, chicken with fried morning glory and a hot-pot for 2!
The food arrived quickly and was excellent quality. The sauce on the morning glory was the tastiest we have had. The chicken in clay pot was succulent, moist and fabulous. The hot-pot was huge and took some eating, with great quality beef the star of the show.
Beers and other drinks were cheap and all delivered in a quiet, unassuming manner by the waitresses.
We were pleased with the bill and absolutely stuffed at the end of the meal.
Highly recommended.

title: Afternoon drinks
text:
We found this place a 5 minute walk from the lake and had a couple of drinks in the afternoon. The place has a bar, tv and pool table with a huge range of drinks including cocktails.
It was quite dark and dingy inside but the decor was pleasing and comfortable.
We had beers and cocktails, plus hot red wine, which was a pleasant surprise on a cool, rainy day.
Local beer at 20k and cocktails at 80k were pretty good quality and value for money.

title: Early evening meal
text:
An ideal food stop opposite the pub! After a couple of drinks we stopped here for a family meal.
A very open cafe-feeling restaurant with no frills, but very good food. The menu has lots of choice with a range of drinks and food available. We considered lots of options and then saw the special offer. There are set menu options with a drink, soup + bread, sizzling hot plate of meat (choice of chicken, fish, beef or pork) with plain rice plus a banana chocolate crepe. This all for around 100k.
An easy choice for the adults, while the teenagers opted for pizza.
Food was good quality and really tasty. Drinks were cold and all was very good value. The waitresses were efficient and pleasant, so it was a very good experience all round.

title: Pizza night
text:
We decided to have a pizza night on our last night here.
We were impressed with the main waiter whose English is very good - it seems there are sister restaurants in other parts of the country, some pizza and some Vietnamese.
They have a wood-fired pizza oven and pizza is made from fresh dough so you can watch. The food came very quickly and the pizzas were very good, thin and crispy with good toppings. The salads were a disappointment as there wasn't enough avocado and the chicken Caesar salad wasn't great and the chicken wasn't great quality. Pesto bread was tasty, but prices are a bit above local prices.

title: Brunch or any meal!
text:
We saw this place as we walked along the front a few times. Eventually stopped to view the menu and a guy with a huge smile invited us in. How could we resist?
We were on a late breakfast/early lunch timescale, so some opted for omelette and some for baguette sandwiches and we were all pleased with our food.
The cheese, ham and veg omelette was the best I have tasted in 2 weeks in Vietnam and the baguettes were good-sized, nicely filled and very tasty.
Drinks variety is huge and reasonably priced and the whole meal for 4 came out at less than £12.
Very pleased and it is as good as anything around in Cat Ba.
Waiters are very attentive and efficient and the whole thing just works!

title: Rainy day brunch
text:
This place didn't appear straight away when I searched, but I am glad we found it. On a rainy morning, we wanted somewhere close to our hotel so we went here late morning.
It looks only like a hotel from the street, but once inside we were directed up to the roof and found a quaint little garden rooftop with covered and open seating.
The menu is in English and very clear. A good range of food and drink at very good value. Portions are large and food quality is very good. We ate a version of the Thai soup TomYum (chicken), Pad Thai, BBQ chicken and fried squid with satay sauce. The blended ice coffee was also excellent and great value for money.
The staff were very friendly. Food takes a little time, but we were not in a rush.
Lovely little experience.

title: Evening meal
text:
We saw the reviews and decided to give it a go early evening. We were the first there, so had the choice of seats. We ordered drinks which arrived very quickly, the milkshake a little longer. Good beer and Mojito.
The food arrived and we were not disappointed by pesto pasta and burger. Also really tasty was the chicken lemongrass. However, the most amazing was the braised pork in coconut, which was so tasty and succulent.
Dessert was a tasty crepe and 4 of us shared 2, as we were very full.
Waitresses were excellent and all in all it was a successful meal. The attention to detail with the food was matched by the internal decor. Fab!

title: Evening waterside meal
text:
We saw reviews and decided to give it a go. It was a 15 minute walk which looked like leading us to a little backwater, but we soon found the place and were seated quickly at a street table. The place was busy and people were having to wait, but seemed content to have a drink at the bar. The cocktail barman was a superb showman too.
Our cocktails were freshly made and beer was at Happy Hour price, which made it even cheaper! We ate burgers, fried noodle seafood and fried rice seafood - all very tasty and good-sized portions.
A very pleasant evening.

title: Small-town feel
text: What a lovely feel to this area. Tree-lined avenues with amazing buildings, shops, restaurants and small business everywhere. Busy and bustling, but calm and ordered at the same time. Plenty of places to go and just wander around, if you can deal with the heat!

title: Mid evening meal with teenage girls
text:
We decided to try this place as it is very close to where we are staying. It was busy at 20:30 and we were quickly seated and attended to. Waiter was very efficient, using a tablet for orders, bringing drinks first and returning for food orders. I asked for a recommendation which was excellent and the other dishes were good. Drinks cheap, food great and cheap. Everyone was happy.
We will return.

title: Great 'sister's hotel
text:
We stayed at Chez Mimosa Boutique hotel 60m away last year and again this year. As part of the deal, you get a free drink here during Happy Hour in the rooftop bar. All of the staff are amazingly helpful and friendly and some work at both hotels. The drinks are very good - more pricey than other places, but it is a rooftop bar after all. Food is also available on a limited menu, but again also good quality.
Worth a visit

title: Still great one year later!
text:
We ate here last year and were very pleased, but sad that we only found it on our last night. This year we came back and brought my sister and her family!
Again, we were very pleased with everything - the food quality, the quantity, the service and the price.
We ate squid, eel, frog legs, chicken, octopus, morning glory, pak choi, lots of rice plus beers and soft drinks.
Wow, we were so full and the meal cost about £24 for 7 of us!
A great place, a friendly welcome. What more could you ask?

title: Weekend with friends
text: We stayed here as location was great and it proved to be excellent. Checked in across the way and then walked round the corner to find our rooms in the quiet annex. Rooms were spotlessly clean, usual facilities, bathroom and tea/coffee-making facility. Large, comfortable bed and very quiet. Staff were friendly and efficient. All good

title: 5-course tasting menu
text:
Every so often, we eat here and sample the tasting menu when there is an offer on, or whenever we have a special occasion. We recently went here as a couple, to dine on a Thursday evening. The place is bright and airy, with clean lines and a comfortable feel. Staff are professional and attentive, without being overly fussy. They are well-trained and efficient, with attention to detail and a 'can-do' attitude.
The food is always of a very high standard and always slightly surprising in character - different slants on traditional foods, which make dining a very interesting and exciting experience at times, with flavoursome combinations.
Again, we were delighted with the food and completely full at the end of the meal.
Super experience once again. It is a delight to eat here.

title: Tasty lunch
text: Went here for a spot of lunch and enjoyed it thoroughly. The place is a bit 'open' and exposed but it means you get to watch the street easily. The food came quickly, was good quality and tasty. It would have been nice to have slightly larger portions, but it was fine.

title: Outstanding
text: This place deserves more than 5 stars, because for the price you pay, it is outstanding. From off the street it is a humble, unassuming place with glass doors leading to a reception area. When you get to your room, it is amazing. Spacious, airy and well decorated, our family room had a large double bed and 2 singles, each with their own room equipped with TV and air con. Windows are double glazed keeping the noise of the street to a distant hum. The staff could not be more welcoming, friendly, helpful and accommodating. Fluent English is spoken by the people in reception and nothing is too much trouble - from assisting you with tours, changing large denomination notes and buying (and cutting up) fresh pineapple for you, to organising airport transfers, turning down the beds at night, delivering foot-baths each evening and doing your laundry! We have had the most amazing stay here and just wish we had longer. We LOVE this place.

title: Buzzing with locals
text: After reading the reviews, we had to give this place a try as it is just 2 minutes walk from our hotel. It is just as described. A vibrant, busy, bustling restaurant filled with local people obviously enjoying themselves. Prices are really good and the range of different foods is amazing. We tried a variety, opting for crispy squid, chicken and noodles, garlic snails and spicy prawns and steamed rice, washed down with soft drinks and beers. All tasty and good quality and large potions of everything. Food arrived very quickly and the staff were amazingly attentive - down to the young boy who kept topping up our glasses with large pieces of ice. Super value - all for under 420,000 ( about £13)

title: Views, food and drink
text: We returned to this rooftop bar to eat, after having drinks here the previous evening. The menu is limited, but the range is enough for you to have a reasonable choice. Food quality is very good and the staff are excellent. Very attentive and speaking fluent English. A top spot!
place: Rice Terrace Restaurant – Authentic Vietnamese Cuisine

title: Pleasant visit
text: We read about this place and contacted them through Facebook to book a table aiming to see sunset. This happens around 18:20 at the moment so we got there at 18:00 ish and were promptly seen to a table. There is a range of cocktails and other drinks including craft beers and imported lagers but the prices are appreciably higher than street level in the same vicinity. The food looked ok but we opted for drinks only. Cocktails were well mixed and the beer tasty, but just a bit over-priced I felt. Staffing was plentiful and efficient. The views were OK from our 7th floor vantage point.

title: Surprisingly good
text:
We have walked past a few times and not ventured in, so tonight we popped in for dinner. Quickly met and seated, we took our time considering the menu options and were pleasantly surprised by the prices. We opted for Thai food and Australian wine. The food arrived reasonably quickly and the quality was very good. Food is well presented and you are provided with a eange of condiments to suit your taste (including extra chilli).
Service was discreet and efficient and the overall experience was very pleasant. We will go back.

title: Great fish, super chips
text:
We have two main outlets for fish and chips and Savages probably just pips it for quality. The fish we had were absolutely perfect. Moist, tasty and perfectly cooked with just the right amount of tasty batter. Both fish and chips were not at all greasy or fatty/oily.
We were hugely impressed. At least one member of our family uses them every week.

title: Late afternoon drinks
text: This place is a little quirky and pleasant enough to spend an hour or so in. We dropped by late afternoon and they were expecting 2 large parties, but said we could have drinks until they arrived, so that was fine.

title: Cosy and welcoming
text: We read the reviews and went each day we were there (four days). On the 4th day, it was just too busy and Peter reluctantly couldn't accommodate us, but we understood. The place is small but that's part of the appeal. The other appeal is the excellent food and affordable drinks. the garlic potato was divine, the garlic bread rolls excellent, the pizza superb, the spinach and cheese dish delicious. An open fire greeted us on every occasion, alongside a genuine warmth from the staff. Even when tables were 'booked', they attempted to fit people in, even for a short stay. You MUST book for the evenings if you go in busy weeks, as everyone now knows about this gem, but late afternoon, you can chance it and get lucky. Super place.

title: Friendly and good value
text: The number of options on this area is absolutely bewildering and it is difficult to choose unless you have a clear idea what you want. We didn't want American, Italian or Mexican so we opted for this place with clear menus and photos with reasonable prices. We weren't disappointed. The service was friendly and fast with plenty of staff. The place was busy, but everywhere was! We had a range of well-cooked, tasty food and a couple of rounds of drinks for less than $40. Just beware of the 10% tax that needs to go on the bill at the end. A good place to eat, right in the heart of the action.

title: Awesome
text:
Visiting in the 25th anniversary year of it being a World Heritage Site, we were prepared to be impressed by Angkor Wat and surrounding temples, but we were unprepared for the extent of the area covered. Our hotel provided us with a driver for $25 and we left at 04:30 to be there for sunrise. There is a detour en route, to buy tickets and everyone with the same idea congregated at the rows of ticket counters to purchase ticks for one day ($37) or longer. Don't join the wrong queue! It's easy to do, as you are half asleep and it's not quite as obvious as you would like. Anyway, the complex is another short ride north where you show your tickets and gain entry. Angkor Wat is most people's first port of call and is impressive from the front, but even more impressive once you get in and explore. You could easily take 2 hours here.
Next on the 'mini tour' route is an even larger collection of temples with a clearly signposted route for you negotiate the maze of structures. Again, the scale is vast. Bring plenty of water, sun protection and strong legs - the walking is reasonably challenging at times. More temples are dotted across an even more vast area and can be visited on the short route and we spent 6 hours doing just that! The hotel suggested it might even take us 9. Anything longer than 6 hours with teenage daughters is (I would suggest) for the hardened historian and temple addict. Great experience and awe inspiring.

title: Hugely impressive
text: Even larger than it's more famous neighbour, this can be accessed on the same tour as Angkor Wat and provides an even larger area for exploration and photo opportunity. There is a clear route via which to walk through the myriad of temple buildings and you are encouraged to walk in, up and around all of the buildings - which is refreshing I think. There are some 'no-go' areas but on the whole it is all very accessible if you are reasonably fit and determined. Dress suitably, with long shorts and covered shoulders.

title: Another fascinating temple
text: To be honest, we were almost "templed out" by the time we made it to Ta Prohm as we had spent the best part of 6 hours doing the rounds of the more famous temples earlier in the tour. On its own it is hugely impressive as an ancient monument and is well worth a visit.

title: Good food at good prices
text:
We went here after looking at some reviews and were not disappointed. We found the place just off the main drag past Beer Street and were seated in the already-busy restaurant. Orders were taken and the main fella was brilliant with sorting everyone out. Food came at different times as-and-when it was ready and the chicken breast took a long time to arrive, but when it did ....... wow, it was worth the wait. Vietnamese food was great too and beers were cheap
Four of us with food and drinks for $17. Great little eating experience.

title: Mayhem madness!
text: Coming to Cambodia, we had expected things to be a little less manic than Bangkok and Vietnam but this place is absolutely buzzing. We wandered around on a Friday night and it had the feel of a night market with roads becoming pedestrian areas and bars and restaurants all competing for business. Pub Street is lively, loud, busy, vibrant and eclectic in terms of food outlets. I didn't really like it to start with but it soon grew on me and even though many places are very over-priced, you can still find reasonably priced restaurants where you can sit and people-watch and enjoy the vibe. Must visit if in Siem Reap.

title: Historic and interesting
text: We took a private car here - no need to book a tour if your English is OK. It takes about an hour from Hoi An by taxi. We arrived at the gates to buy a ticket which is 150000 VND and from there you take a short walk to the museum and past there 2 minutes to the electric buggies which transport you for 5 mins further up the valley to the second stage. Here you get out and walk the trail to the temple ruins usually in a clockwise direction. However, we went anticlockwise to get to the Cham dancing performance which was due to start in 30mins, so we made the shortest route. The dancing was fun and interesting with some live music. Then we walked the ancient ruins. There are information boards at each set of temple ruins which are written in English which helps of you don't have a guide. Interesting and a beautiful location.

title: Fantastic tour
text: We had the most amazing day on this tour which we booked a day in advance as we liked the sound of the variety. We were picked up from the hotel and driven to meet Hanh eat the market, where we were shown the huge array of local produce and it was explained to us how the foods can be used in local cooking. It was a really interesting experience on its own but we were then taken by car to the river, where we motored down the river and even had a go at steering the vessel! Stopping off at a tiny jetty, we disembarked and then were ushered into small round paddle boats - two to a boat with a 'captain' paddling. Well, we have not laughed so much in a long time as we were entertained by crazy paddling, music and incredible art as the Vietnamese made crickets and hats and fish from the plants at the side of the river. It was then onto the restaurant where we made 4 courses of food and ate it afterwards. It was brilliant!

title: Beautiful blend of activity and quiet
text: This beach is beautiful in terms of the beach and sea, but also the outlook. The islands and the hills close to Danang north of here are very pretty. Although there are lots of bars and sunloungers which supply a need for the many tourists, everything is low-rise, so it doesn't affect the feel of the place and it still manages to feel quite small. A few minutes walk south of here, you can lose the bars altogether and just have peace and quiet. A great spot to chill and relax, but also lively enough to satisfy your hunger, thirst and desire for watersport activity.

title: Lunch
text: Wide range of dishes to choose from with a large western menu. I think we would have preferred more Vietnamese dishes at a better price, as things are a little over-priced. I understand that western dishes should be more expensive, but not local dishes. Anyway, we were seated quickly and well looked-after and the quality of food was very good. Pleasant place situated right on the beach. Good spot for eating and drinking.
place: Soul Kitchen Beach Bar and Restaurant

title: Super dinner
text: We got here early evening and we had a choice of tables. An hour later the place was full. The food is excellent and tasty with a variety of dishes from which to choose. We chose chicken and ginger, chicken curry, seafood fried rice and seafood fried noodles. All dishes came quickly and were almost as quickly demolished! Delightful staff who were charming and efficient. We are going back tonight we loved it so much.

title: Educational and emotional
text: We took a tour to the tunnels with a Local guide and spent the 2-hour drive talking and asking questions about life before and after the wars. The experience at the tunnels was interesting, educational and sobering as we learnt about the development of the system and the people who lived in and used the tunnels. The actual experience of entering the tunnels and 'walking' through them was challenging, as I am 6'2" but it was do-able with a positive attitude. No to be missed when you have made the effort to get there. Our teenage daughters fully enjoyed the whole day, learning about what happened and the history lesson was important and interesting. They were fascinated. Wonderful experience.

title: Impressive building
text: We visited here and also the church opposite. An impressive building which resembles a train station has an airy feel to it and is still partly functioning today - you can send postcards from here.

title: Huge variety of goods
text: If you want to experience a truly 'local' market, then this is the place to go. Even the locals have to barter hard to get the right price. There is an amazing variety of goods to buy, from clothing and bags, to fruit, vegetables and meat. It is an experience to just walk around and see the range of produce. Well worth the effort.

title: Pretty church
text: This church opposite the post office is an attractive building to take photos of from the outside. When we were there, it was under renovation and lots of the building was covered in scaffolding. It will be like this for 2 years apparently. From the front, it is still a pleasant church to admire.

title: Great fun
text:
We travelled as a family with 2 teenage daughters, so it seemed like a good idea to do the Sights tour which took in a lot of the major tourist sights of the city, but did so in a short (ish) time-frame. The other consideration was the all-female riders, as we have 2 daughters.
The young ladies were very good as guides and excellent drivers at negotiating the crazy streets of HCMC. At each venue, we met with a young male guide who spoke excellent English and who explained the significance of each venue extremely well, being very happy to engage in conversation rather than simply roll out pre-rehearsed information. The 3 and a half hours exceeded our expectations and we were also treated to various snacks and drinks as we went along. It is amazing fun zipping around the streets on the back of a scooter, driven by a local! Highly recommended.

title: Nice place ..... but...
text: We went here while staying at the Travelodge only a short stroll down the road. After seeing the reviews we decided to check it out and it was open at 6pm on a Saturday BUT, we wanted food and were told that the kitchens had closed AND that the bar would also be closing shortly as there wasn't much trade! We had a drink and sat in the (very noisy, but pleasant) beer garden under the flight path! Shame, as the place had appealing decor but is obviously short on customers.

title: Friendly and helpful
text: Now called D Heart Hostel, this little gem is a small, friendly little stop-off very close to DMK airport. Communication has been excellent, even down to messaging me when we arrived in BKK to say they had our room ready for an early check in. Fab value for money, hot shower, fridge, hot drinks, comfy bed and air-con all made the visit pleasant. The lady even walked us to a local restaurant with menus only in Thai but introduced us to the owners who looked after us! 5* treatment in a budget hostel. Love it.

title: Very efficient and smooth
text: The Skytrain runs high above the mayhem of Bangkok and provides a quiet, safe means of exploring the city. It isn't mega-cheap, but is fine and means you stay out of the dirt, grime, fumes and noise of the city streets - but that is actually part of the appeal of Bangkok, so 'you takes your choice'. The Skytrain is now very close to connecting DMK airport with the rest of the city and this should really change things at the north end of the city.

title: Day tripping!
text:
A second day trip over to Calais via Eurotunnel was paid for by Calais Wine Superstore, as I committed to buy at least £250 of wine. This would not have been a problem for me and it was even less of a problem when I took along a mate. Ordered online and received an email detailing crossing times and procedures no problem. The crossing done, we quickly found the warehouse and the helpful, efficient, English-speaking staff had already prepared my order and it was loaded ready on a trolley. No need to rush though, as there is ample opportunity to sample more wine and make further purchases if you so desire.
Paid and loaded the wine with loads of time left to explore the surrounding area. Great fun and good quality wine at less than half the UK price. What's not to like :)

title: Seafood delight
text:
We walked around the night market and saw this restaurant with good-looking seafood on display. After a short chat with the friendly waiter out front, we decided to go for the set meal of King prawn and tuna steak (there were 3 options whig included shark steak too). Our daughters opted for snapper fillet and chicken steak and the whole atmosphere was very friendly, attentive and efficient.
Food arrived fairly quickly and was of a high quality. The nearest waitress even noticed that we had almost finished our sauces, so she brought more without being asked.
Good value food and reasonable prices for seafood. Would recommend highly.

title: Snapper heaven
text:
We decided to try this restaurant on a rainy Sunday evening and we were drawn in by the "Red Snapper - 260 Baht" offer.
I had the snapper with garlic sauce, my wife and daughter had massive plates of battered calamari and my other daughter had a huge bowl of fried chicken and chips. Big portions and good quality all round.
We were seated quickly and efficiently and the staff were more than pleasant and attentive. The atmosphere was relaxed and the surroundings comfortable.
Food was reasonably priced and affordable - 1000 Baht for 4 meals and drinks. A very good experience.

title: Early evening dinner
text:
As a family of four, we went for an early dinner at Second Nature, just a few metres off the main drag at Hat Lamai, at the first junction on the one-way system.
It is easy to find and very close to the main road filled with bars and restaurants.
We were early, so we had the place fairly much to ourselves and opted to eat at the front table, backed by pretty fairy lights under a fan.
We were very well attended to, the service being excellent and 'proper' without being fussy and nothing was too much trouble. After ordering, we were given some excellent complimentary bread and our meal arrived quite quickly. The quality was excellent and I can recommend the lamb burger - delicious.
A pleasant, laid-back dinner.

title: Early evening visit
text:
We walked from Lamai central strip north to where the Sunday Night market sets up and found this place. From the outside it has a cafe-type appearance with open sides and minimalist interior.
However, the menu looked very promising with a huge range from which to choose. My one reservation was whether they could produce the quality with such a large menu.
We ordered starters which came along first (which doesn't always happen in Thailand) and they were delicious and quite large. Main courses were BBQ ribs, chicken breast with mushrooms, King prawns with garlic sauce and sea bass with scallop. The quality was excellent, very nicely presented and portion sizes were just right.
We would recommended giving this place a try. It's only a 10 minute walk from the market.

title: Super little jewellery store
text:
Bow's jewellery store is an excellent little place open in the evenings, which sells very reasonably-priced jewellery and trinkets etc. Prices are marked and obvious, but they are also affordable, with some discount for multi-buys.
There is always someone on hand to deal with your questions and needs without any 'hard sell' tactics at all. Most of the time it is quite busy and that tells it's own story.
We love it here and we return year after year. Stock up with prezzies for people back home!

title: Late lunch overlooking the beach
text:
A high quality meal on the beach front. The menu was very extensive, with Thai and European food, also French-based.
Portions are large and prices reflect the quality of the dishes. Food quality is excellent and the ambience was busy and bustling indoors and a little quieter outside.
Squid and carbonara were the favourite dishes and both were large portions.
Overall a good experience.

title: Watching footy
text:
We went here for the second time in a few days on a Saturday night to have a drink or two and take in the Premiership football on the screens.
Plenty of helpful staff, eager to find you a table and then serve you. First drinks come with a 'chit' which is placed on the table and added to if you have subsequent drinks. Just pay at the end of your stay there.
Drinks are reasonably-priced and a good selection of alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks. The atmosphere is buzzing and the place usually quite busy. There is also a pool table at the rear of the bar.
Good place to chill with friends or pass the time on your own.

title: Food and shopping galore
text:
This is a 'must' if you are in Lamai on a Sunday evening. The roads are closed off just to the north of the main strip of Hat Lamai and turned into a "cross-shaped" market ares for all manner if goods and food.
The North/South roads of the cross are all clothes, shoes, bags, shawls and many other souvenirs etc. The East/West of the cross is all food stalls with an amazing variety, some of which is repeated from time to time along the strip.
It gets very busy and don't expect to just bag a bargain; you still have to haggle to get the best prices but some prices are fixed if you prefer that. Expect to shuffle along getting hot and sweaty, but a good experience even if you buy nothing!

title: Watching English footy
text: Watched a Prem footy game from the bar on the street. Can only comment on the bar side of things, but really over-priced Chang. Spent 120 Baht each for two schooners of Chang and reluctantly gave 240 Baht, only to be given a bill for 259 Baht after tax was added! A real rip-off and not in keeping with the other bars on the main strip. Not good value for money at all, when you can get similar beer for 50 Baht in bars.

title: Absolute paradise
text:
Beautiful, golden, wide beach which is kept immaculately clean. Safe and shallow, with little ebb and flow and no undertow. Real family friendly beach to kick back and relax. Some beach hawkers with jewelery, fruit, fabric, ice cream etc but they don't hassle you.
We come back year after year. Now 12 years since we brought the girls aged 4 and 5 and we love it!

title: Good food, service and atmosphere
text:
This has been our favourite 'treat' restaurant over the past 10 years and although a bit more expensive than many, the food, service and ambience is top quality.
The range on the menu has been extended recently and there are quite a few Japanese options alongside Thai and Western dishes. The wine menu is extensive, but expensive, so it's more of a special occasion splash-out.
The staff are very friendly, well-trained and attentive and the place is usually busy. We love it.

title: One night stopover
text:
Stayed here in a family room for one night. The room was very clean and large with en-route bathroom, a large king size bed and bunk beds for the kids. Beautifully decorated walls and very comfortable beds. Coffee making facilities free of charge along with bottled water.
Check in and check out process was very easy. One slight gripe was that they charged an extra 5.9% for paying by card, but didn't eplain that at the time. I only noticed 10 mins later in he room! A bit naughty I think.
Breakfast in the cafe downstairs was substantial, tasty and quick to arrive. An enjoyable stay.
place: Parasol Inn Chiang Mai Old City Hotel

title: Pleasant family meal
text: We had a good meal here as a family of four. The menu is very clear, with Thai, English and photos to help you choose. Prices are reasonable and there is a choice of indoor and outdoor tables. Inside is air con and outside there are some tables under fans. Staff are pleasant and helpful. Food is good quality and portions are quite large.

title: Adventures centred around relaxing guesthouse
text:
Where to start? The welcoming, relaxing laid-back atmosphere in the open-sided communal room with good, reasonably priced food can be the core of your stay here. Rooms are basic but adequate with fans and hot water in an idyllic setting close to the river and a 10 min walk from Cave Lod.
Plenty to do with a huge range of caving trips and an array of kayaking opportunities to choose from. You can take advantage of the guided trips or be self-sufficient. We just completed an awesome 2-day trek to Lahu and Karen hilltribe with an excellent guide. Challenging but so worthwhile.
Take a mini bus to Pai and grab a taxi for the final hour into the mountains. Come with a sense of adventure and/or a need to kick back and relax.

title: Impressive size
text:
A huge cave with bamboo bridges, bats and plenty of stalagmites and stalactites alongside a plethora of formations. A local guide is mandatory if you arrive on foot. We entered during a kayak trip via Cave Lodge which was great.
If you can get to the outflow at dusk, there are 500,000 swifts to watch returning to roost.

title: Cheap and tasty dinner
text:
We ate here as a family with 2 teenage daughters. Plenty of range to choose from. Food arrived quickly and was very tasty. Even the small pizza was quite large enough for one person.
Great value for money.
place: Uno Pizza Italy & Thai Food Restaurant

title: Super cheap eats
text: Went to check out the good reviews and were impressed. Great tasting food from curries to pizza and drinks very well priced. Quite a small place and not so easy to find, but we will be back. Excellent value.

title: Doi Inthanon National Park day trip
text: A full day of fun with 10.5 hours away from our guesthouse. Picked up and taken back at the end of the day, with a driver and English-speaking guide who was excellent. Range of experiences from trekking through 'jungle' terrain alongside a river with some impressive waterfalls to see. Visited a local coffee bean producer which is a real 'cottage industry'. Excellent lunch and finally the temples/pagodas for the King and Queen. Would recommend for anyone with a bit of fitness.

title: Tasty food and friendly staff
text:
A quiet pub atmosphere with very tasty food. Good range of drinks and hand-pull beers, cider and bottled ciders etc.
Food served quickly and by friendly, unobtrusive staff who can't do enough for you. Well worth a visit.

title: Good 'local' with great value food
text: A small and friendly local pub with a bar area and two 'lounge' type rooms where you can sit and eat. Good bar staff, usually ticking over with customers and often quite busy. Food is very good and never too long to wait. A wide range to choose from at a consistently high standard for pub-grub.
